addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight Principall Secretary to her Ma
tie
.

29
th
Novemb
r
1589
From M
r
Bodleigh.
In favor of Lieutenant Lashford.

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H this gentleman
M
r
Lashford
, Lieutenant to
e company of
S
r
John
Scotte
, whiche was lately bestowed uppon
Cap
t
Hais
, hath served six yeres in
Irland,
and in these contreis five yere, in
e degree
of a Lieutenant. He was also present at
e
last service done at Berke,] where he and his
company were placed in that part of
e Rere-
ward, that sustened
e chiefest brunt of
e
Enemies force. For these respectes, and for
at
S
r
Francis Vere
doth highly commend his valew
and f orwardnes in
at c
o
flict, I could not
but commend him to yo
r
H. and request in
his behalf, that if
Cap
t
Bannester
shall
give over his rowme, it may please yo
r
H
to be a meanes, that it be bestowed uppon
him: who, as it should seeme by his speeches to
me, hath obtened already Capt Bannesters
promise unto it.
Referring his sute to yo
r
honorable considerac
o
n, I take my humble leave.
From
e Hage. 29 N
o
89
Yo
r
H. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley.
The Magistrats of
Utrecht
have
founde
e meanes, partly by threatning,
and partly w
t
faire speeche, to cause
the mutins of
Wijcke
to abandon the fort:
where others are placed.
Likewise
e mutinie of
Sgravesweert,
for
6000
li
sterling, whiche the states have
hardly gathered, and sent unto them, is
nowe at an end,
e old souldiers qui-
etly displaced, and newe companies
admitted.
